com.mot.rfid.api3

Class NXP

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mot.rfid.api3.NXP

  • public class NXP
extends java.lang.Object
    The NXP class comprises of the Access operations meant for NXP tags. These operation include SetEASWait and SetEASEvent(for setting/resetting EAS bits on NXP tags), ReadProtectWait & ResetReadProtectEvent(for setting the Quiet bit on one or more NXP tags), ResetReadProtectEvent(for resetting Quiet bit on all the NXP tags

      • SetEASWait

        public void SetEASWait(java.lang.String tagID,
                       NXP.SetEASParams setEASParams,
                       AntennaInfo antennaInfo)
                throws InvalidUsageException,
                       OperationFailureException
        This API sets/resets the EAS bit of the NXP tag whose ID is passed to the API.
        Parameters:
        tagID - string value of Tag ID
        setEASParams - consists of accesspassword and desired state of the EAS bit of the tag
        antennaInfo - set of antennae on which this access operation is to be performed
        Throws:
        InvalidUsageException
        OperationFailureException

      • setEASEvent

        public void setEASEvent(NXP.SetEASParams setEASParams,
                        AccessFilter accessFilter,
                        AntennaInfo antennaInfo)
                 throws InvalidUsageException,
                        OperationFailureException
        This API sets/resets the EAS bits of all the NXP tags specified by the access-filter.
        Parameters:
        setEASParams - consists of the Access password and desired EAS bit state
        accessFilter - defines the set of tag-population on which the access operation is to be applied
        antennaInfo - defines the set of antennae on which this access operation is to be applied
        Throws:
        InvalidUsageException
        OperationFailureException

      • readProtectWait

        public void readProtectWait(java.lang.String tagID,
                            NXP.ReadProtectParams readProtectParams,
                            AntennaInfo antennaInfo)
                     throws InvalidUsageException,
                            OperationFailureException
        An NXP tag can be protected from reading (i.e, Quiet mode) by calling the "ReadProtectWait" method. It requires the Access-password for the NXP tag. The antenna-ID list on which the operation is to be performed is also AntennaInfo taken by the method.
        Parameters:
        tagID - NXP-tag's ID
        readProtectParams - contains the Access-password for the tag
        antennaInfo - Contains the list of antenna-IDs on which the operation is to be performed
        Throws:
        InvalidUsageException
        OperationFailureException

      • readProtectEvent

        public void readProtectEvent(NXP.ReadProtectParams readProtectParams,
                             AccessFilter accessFilter,
                             AntennaInfo antennaInfo)
                      throws InvalidUsageException,
                             OperationFailureException
        A set of NXP tags can be read-protected or put into Quiet mode by calling ReadProtectEvent method The method takes in the filter criteria for this set of tags while a null value for access-filter corresponds to entire tag population Addtionally, the antenna IDs on which the operation is to be performed can also be specified
        Parameters:
        readProtectParams - consists of the Access password
        accessFilter - defines the set of tag-population on which the access operation is to be applied
        antennaInfo - defines the set of antennae on which this access operation is to be applied
        Throws:
        InvalidUsageException
        OperationFailureException

      • resetReadProtectEvent

        public void resetReadProtectEvent(NXP.ResetReadProtectParams resetReadProtectParams,
                                  AntennaInfo antennaInfo)
                           throws InvalidUsageException,
                                  OperationFailureException
        All the NXP tags with the same Access-Password can be put out of the Quiet-Mode.Hence,they will no longer be read-protected.
        Parameters:
        resetReadProtectParams - consists of Access-password for the NXP tags
        antennaInfo - consists of list of antenna IDs on which this access operation is to be applied
        Throws:
        InvalidUsageException
        OperationFailureException

      • ChangeConfigWait

        public TagData ChangeConfigWait(java.lang.String tagID,
                                NXP.ChangeConfigParams changeConfigParams,
                                AntennaInfo antennaInfo)
                         throws InvalidUsageException,
                                OperationFailureException
        This API Changes and reads the current Configuration of an NXP G2iL tag whose ID is passed to the API.Changing the Configuration word helps enable/disable special features supported by the G2iL tag such as Read protection,Read-range reduction,ProductStatusFlag Alarm and others. Please refer to the G2iL tag's documentation for a comprehensive list of features and their corresponding configuration bits.
        Parameters:
        tagID - Tag ID
        changeConfigParams - consists of access password and the Configuration word to be applied.If the latter is zero, no change is made on the Configuration word and the current configuration is reported back in TagData
        antennaInfo - set of antennae on which this access operation is to be performed
        Returns:
        Tag Data
        Throws:
        InvalidUsageException
        OperationFailureException

      • ChangeConfigEvent

        public void ChangeConfigEvent(NXP.ChangeConfigParams ChangeConfigParams,
                              AccessFilter accessFilter,
                              AntennaInfo antennaInfo)
                       throws InvalidUsageException,
                              OperationFailureException
        This API Changes and reads the current Configuration of the NXP G2iL tags specified by AccessFilter. Changing the Configuration word helps enable/disable special features supported by the G2iL tag such as Read protection,Read-range reduction,ProductStatusFlag Alarm and others. Please refer to the G2iL tag's documentation for a comprehensive list of features and their corresponding configuration bits. Tags will be reported as notifications if the application has registered for Events.ReadNotify event. Else the Tags will be fetched using GetReadTags(s) methods. Completion of Access operation will be reported as Events.StatusNotify event of type ACCESS_STOP_EVENT.
        Parameters:
        ChangeConfigParams - consists of access password and the Configuration word to be applied.If the latter is zero, no change is made on the Configuration word and the current configuration is reported back in TagData
        accessFilter - Access Filter Criteria
        antennaInfo - Antennas on which the current operation is to be performed. If this is null, operation will be performed on all Antennas
        Throws:
        InvalidUsageException
        OperationFailureException
